subject: Re: Why doesn't JUnit count asserts
msgSnippet: Wow, this has been an interesting topic. From the discussion, several things are evident: * counting assertions can be a useful metric * as a metric it can be
messageBody:
Wow, this has been an interesting topic.

From the discussion, several things are evident:
* counting assertions can be a useful metric
* as a metric it can be abused
* many organizations want to use this metric
* many organizations don't want this metric

I just pointing out the obvious because this has become "religious
war". Why not provide the ability to count metrics. Those who want
it can use it. Those who dont want it can ignore it.

- Greg
